Putting all together:

The C code structure would be:

#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>
#include <stdlib.h>

int main() {
    char s[100000];
    fgets(s, sizeof(s), stdin);

    char my_str[100000];
    int len =0;
    for(int i=0; s[i] != '\0'; i++) {
        char c = s[i];
        if (c == '0' || c == '1') {
            my_str[len++] = c;
        } else if (c == 'B' && len >0) {
            len--;
        }
    }
    my_str[len] = '\0';

    long long n;
    char *endptr;
    n = strtoull(my_str, &endptr, 10);
    if (*endptr != '\0') { // invalid input, but according to problem's setup, it should be valid
        // handle error, but perhaps just proceed?
        // assuming the input is valid as per first program's output
    }

    long long k = (n *2 +1)/3;

    if (k ==0) {
        printf("-1\n");
        return 0;
    }

    long long r =0;
    for (long long i=1; i<=k; i++) {
        r = (r *10 +7) % k;
        if (r ==0) {
            printf("%lld\n", i);
            return 0;
        }
    }
    printf("-1\n");
    return 0;
}
